statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -1 \\ -5 \\ 4 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -3 \\ -4 \\ 4 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 2 \\ 10 \\ -8 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 15 \\ 3 \\ -18 \\ 12 \\ 33 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -1 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -1 \\ -5 \\ 4 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -3 \\ -4 \\ 4 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 2 \\ 10 \\ -8 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 15 \\ 3 \\ -18 \\ 12 \\ 33 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -1 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5.
